Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siumee
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade from studio to 2 bedroom apartment. The area, rooms and toilets are more than enough for 2 of us. The apartment is clean and comfortable. Staff are OK. The hotel location is very good. Within 10 min. walk to Shraaf DG Station or the Mall of the Emirates where there are free shuttle buses to large hotels, e.g The Atlantis at the Palm. We also have our dinner at the Kimpinski Hotel at Mall of Emirate. Their daily special is well worth the money. Taking taxi to Burj al Arab or the Madinat is cheap and only takes 10 min. WiFi is only available in the sitting room of 2 bedroom apartment which is quite inconvenient. Breakfast has very limited choices and taste not good. The toilet at the ground floor is not clean. We booked 3 months in advance via HRS and got a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Clean but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: RamMohanBanjul
Reviews.Content: Booked in through Make My Trip and found the property quite conveniently located, though no way walk able to the Mall of the Emirates as advertised. The Mall is about a KM away as the crow flies but if you have to walk there, you will probably have to walk all the way around and run across roads without Zebra crossings and wild Dubai drivers paths.. Very polite staff and clean rooms, though you will need several reminders to have the rooms cleaned. While you can order from the superette below, they don't stock may small packaged items , thus either shop elsewhere or be prepared to buy kilo / large packets even if you're here forma fewmdaysmlike us. Good value for the double bed room apartment, but possibly overpriced as we could have stayed at the Kempenski by paying 20% more. This is a very convenient location in Al Barsha area and not far from the Sharaf DG Metro statio. The Metro is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tpvasanth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights at this hotel apartments. Great reception and HK staff, helpful and friendly. Hotel is good for business travellers who spend most of the day at office. They serve limited items on the buffet breakfast (Very limited). Another problem it was a bit too repetitive. If you are bored in the evening, Mall of emirates is just about 10 minutes walk from here and the DG Sharaf station (Metro) is right outside which gives you easy and cost friendly travel within city instead of taxis. Was dining at the Indian Restaurant called "Salaam Namaste" which is bang opposite to this hotel (Lunch / Dinner). Food is good there but quite expensive. Took good advantage of hotel's free wifi services. Check if your mobile has a range as I had that issue in the room (Would not get range in some areas).

Reviews.Title: “I took the 2 rooms apartment”
Reviews.Author: Humeid
Reviews.Content: It was great like a 5 star hotel,, staff r very friendly... When u order something doesn't take long to deliver beds r very confortable.. Free wifi and the location is just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Family in tourist mode”
Reviews.Author: Caylene v
Reviews.Content: These apartments are PERFECT for a family who wants to see the whole of Dubai. If you have many activities planned while visiting Dubai, this is the perfect choice, because you will only be sleeping in the apartment. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment, each bedroom with its own full bathroom and another separate toilet. Each bedroom also had a balcony as well as the lounge area. The apartment was VERY spacious and include all the appliances you need to cook or do washing. Just remember to take your own washing powder and your own clothes for the kitchen, as these are not included. The furniture is a bit old, but this won't bother you if you are on-the-go the whole time. It's location is SUPERB, as it is walking distance from The Mall of the Emirates where you can find the Ski Dubai and endless amounts of shops and food. Bottom line....If I had to choose again, knowing how busy our holiday will be and that we would never be at our hotel....I would definitely choose Rose Garden Al Barsha again.

Reviews.Title: “strangely there are lots of cockroaches in the upper floors”
Reviews.Author: JagualElUsek
Reviews.Content: Hi, I liked this hotel, it used to be one of the most amazing hotels I have ever been especially for someone with his family. the apartment is very big and they used to be very clean when it was newly opened. this is my fourth or fifth time I go to this hotel however this is my first time I see such thing. Lots of cockroaches in the upper floors maybe because it's empty and no body went there for a long time, but still this is not an excuse. I informed the reception and more than one time we changed the rooms nearly 4 times until we found one (cockroach free) room. To come to the truth this is annoying and I really hate insects. Still the rooms are really big and enough for the whole family and the hotel apartment has a great location, but there are no activities for the kids but only a small swimming pool Anyway I hope they take care of that cockroaches problem, but I don't believe that I would ever go there again regardless if they solved that issue or didn't. Regards

Reviews.Title: “It's a hell garden”
Reviews.Author: Hurtsplay
Reviews.Content: Its happen to my that while I'm sleeping in morning. the don't distirb tagged at the door and i hear the door knocked a five six time with a pressing a ring continuously I though it's FBI!!!! I surprised by three indians and they said we come for mentainance schedule ]#%*+%#>*#{< :| I call the responsible he was gentleman but I never been in sutiution like that before in hotel with high prise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chinagirl033
Reviews.Content: This is the best apartment/hotel we've stayed at in this area.We booked a one bedroom studio and it was excellent.The lounge was big and light with a balcony, there was a dining area and a big square separate kitchen with all the usual things you'd find in a self catering apartment microwave, hob, washing machine fridge etc.The en-suite bedroom was large also with a small balcony and there were no other buildings overlooking us. The staff were very friendly and the apartment was cleaned everyday with clean bed linen and towels. There was also a second toilet and washroom. There was plenty of parking space in the basement car park and we also used the metro which is very clean and reliable and the station is only a 5 min walk away. There's a great pizza place next door and they will deliver to your room. It's about a 10 min walk to the Mall of the Emirates. We'll definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Neat and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: omafolabomi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and son in 2010, between December 27th and January 7th. The hotel is small, quiet, and very nice, with neat facilities, gym, rooftop pool, and very polite concierges. Also on the Metro path (Sharaf DG Metro station), and just ten minutes walk from the Mall Of The Emirates. We will definitely be back this year!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay for 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: Travellover4444
Reviews.Content: The hotel was "perfect" in every way throughout our 4-night stay---large, comfortable rooms, extremely clean, helpful staff, free wireless internet in rooms, and just about 100 yards/meters from the nearest metro station. Just about a 15-minute walk (800 yards/meters) to the nearby Mall of the Emirates (home of the indoor "Ski Dubai"). There is a wonderful view of the Burj Al Arab and Burj Khalifa from the rooftop pool and terrace. We will stay here again when we return to Dubai. It is a great value for your money! We were very impressed in every way, and you will be very pleased that you selected this hotel for your stay while in Dubai. This place exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking trips to interesting sites”
Reviews.Author: Zmijas
Reviews.Content: Main advantage of this Hotel is very close location to Metro station which is the best transport option in Dubai. Rose Garden is located at walking distance from Mall of Emirates with Ski Dubai. Pool on the roof is not so large, but it is enough for sun-tanning. The Health Center have also a nice gym and saunas. Hotel provides wireless connection to internet, but sometimes its problem to use it. Kitchen was well equipped and nice. Apartment was cleaned regularly, even our dishes was washed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: A3aan
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 bedroom suite and we had a good stay. People may complain about alcohol policy but in most hotels in Dubai have a strict policy (except for the expensive tourist hotels) so this is not the fault of the hotel (it is the law in Dubai). The 2-bedroom apartment we booked was huge. 2 spacious bedrooms, a large kitchen and a large living room. Each bedroom had a bathroom. The apartment was spotless, the beds were comfy and everything was working properly. So we had a great stay. Parking in front of the hotel (free), within walking distance of the metro and supermarket and very close to the Mall of the Emirates (although a little to far to walk, 15-20 minutes). Taxis are everywhere (and cheap). Definitely worth a try, especially when you can book it for a good price (we paid for the apartment 125,- Euro's (600 AED) including all taxes for a night)

Reviews.Title: “Useful information for Western travellers”
Reviews.Author: jaynewcastle11
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for 5 nights in Jan 2011. Have now cancelled, after finding out that the hotel operates a strict no-alcohol ban for all its guests. This includes anyone who fancies just a couple of beers or glass of wine (bought in the duty-free at the airport) in the privacy of their own hotel room in the evening. Posted here for information for travellers, as this was not mentioned on any of the hotel reviewson either the Expedia or TA websites, & I just found out by chance.

Reviews.Title: “not dirty, but very basic and conservative”
Reviews.Author: maguedmj
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy place to stay, needs to be said. Location is ok, 10 mins walking from the mall of Emirates. Staff is nice, but they're obsessed with families. The hotel is a hotel for families, therefore no guests, no couples (if not married), and even if you're going there witha colleague of opposite sex they're suspicious and make sure the colleague is staying at a different floor. Studios are resonably nice and clean, the main problem is the phone connectivity, which is very poor. But it's okay, at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Barsha”
Reviews.Author: tigertam
Reviews.Content: Very close to Mall of the Emirates and walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: brahmasmi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 20 minutes drive from Dubai airport. It is nice, clean friendly with spacious rooms in the apartment . They have Bedroom, Drawing Room, Kitchen with gas, fridge, cutlery- very convenient. There's an ironing board, and washing machine too. They had complimentary fruits and tea/coffee maker. Free internet is available in the room. The breakfast is basic. There's a good mall close-by. You can order a taxi within 5-10 minutes. However some taxis don't go to Sharjha- the twin city where a lot of businesses are located.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff and Smelly rooms!”
Reviews.Author: pigeonpoop
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again and based on the rude staff and agressive manager I would not advise anyone I know to stay here. When we checked in staff lead us to a room that, to put it bluntly, smelled like dead fish. The smell was awful and very strong - but the staff didn't seem to think this was a problem - they merely opened the window and told us that it would be gone in 5 minutes. After 15 minutes the smell did not go away - as expected and I called the reception to ask to be moved rooms. I was told that there were no other rooms available and that the smell was actually paint fumes. I have never smelled paint like this before and the staff must have thought I was stupid. After insisting to be moved - the smell was outrageous - a room suddenly became available. It was much smaller and very loud as it was beside the lifts - but at least it didn't make me want to vomit. We had to fight with staff to be moved room - and were told it woudl happen in 5 minutes - 40 minutes later we were moved. Ontop of this we did not get room service or fresh towels during the next 2 nights of our stay, and when we asked for some tea bags staff reacted like I had asked them to chop off an arm. Teabags were not included in the room price and we were not allowed two more teabags. I asked to speak to the manager to voice my complaints and overall disapointment - and when I did I had an aggressive man shouting at me down the phone. Not exactly what you want from your hotel on your holiday! After checking out we realised a couple of days later that my husband had left a jacket in our room. We called them straight away and were told by the receptionist that the jacket had been found and it would be kept in a cupboard at reception, awaiting collection - with no time limit on collection. We recently went to collect (less than a month later) the jacket and it was no where to be found! After waiting for 45 minutes - staff told us it could not be found, and there was no explanation as to what had happened to it, not even an apology from the staff. The rooms were clean and basic. We chose this hotel because of its location to Mall of the Emirates and relatively closeness toJumeirah Beach. If you don't have to ask for anything other than your room key and bill - this hotel would be fine - but goodness - if you ask for someone to clean your room, fresh towels or teabags - then you might get made to feel like an idiot!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BizFantast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rose Garden Hotel Apartments at Al Barsha (the main one is near Burjuman), it is about 7 minutes' walk away from Mall of Emirates, and there are lots of convenience stores and restaurants around the corner, so location-wise it was still not that bad. What is really bad about the hotel's location is most taxi drivers would never have heard of this hotel, and it would take a lot of effort to make them understand where were you heading to (been taking cabs almost everyday, and none of the drivers knew where the hotel is located). The staff at the hotel were nice, though they do not speak fluent English, they tried their best to accommodate our needs. The rooms were nice, as the hotel was newly built, everything is new. The apartment unit that I stayed in had a 32" LCD TV, a very nice fridge, a washing machine/dryer, a microwave-oven, and a LAN point. Internet access is free. The gym is fantastic -- always empty. Swimming pool is relatively small, but it is a very nice view from the pool, you can see Burj Arab on a clear day. Tip: Get the hotel staff to book you a cab on the day you return, it is impossible to get a cab at Al Barsha area during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kashirizvi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rose Garden Hotel Apartment Al Barsha and it was great... Staff were nice and rooms were well made up and equipped. Rate offered was very competative and I enjoyed my stay..... The only problem that I encountered was that there are very limited mobile signals in the rooms except those facing road. It is must for business traveller and management should look into resolving this problem urgently. I was expecting few business calls but nothing ring until next day and than I realised that I do not have signal in the room... Upon request, staff was effecient and courteous enough to move me to an upgraded room facing the front which was great....

Reviews.Title: “Rose Garden Hotel Apartments, Barsha, Dubai”
Reviews.Author: anom26
Reviews.Content: The location is great, 5 minutes from the Mall of the Emirates. The hotel is clean, facilities are good and the staff are friendly. The rooftop swimming pool was out of order at the start of our stay but is now open again. The only downside to this great place is the construction behind the hotel! The workers have set up camp below the balconies and in the morning (7am), start loading scaffolding onto trucks. Then the hammerdrills start! There is no soundproofing, the noise shakes the room. We tried to move rooms but couldn't get away from the noise unless you took an internal room next to the lifts. Once the construction ends this will be a fantastic hotel, until then, unless you're an early riser I'd be cautious.

HotelInfo.Name: Rose Garden Hotel Apartments - Al Barsha
HotelInfo.Address: Near Mall of the Emirates | Al Barsha, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
